business.headline: Hindenburg questions Madhabi Puri Buch's silence on Congress' allegationsHindenburg Research's statement comes after the Congress party raised fresh allegations about Buch's links to listed companies regulated by Sebi. The short-seller also said that Madhabi Puri Buch has remained silent on the accusations for weeks.

Suzlon Energy hits 5% upper circuit for 2nd straight day. More upside left?Suzlon Energy has seen its stock value more than triple in the last year, gaining 223% over the past 12 months and 102% in 2024 alone.

You can bet on India when chips are down: PM Modi at Semicon India 2024Semicon India 2024 is a three-day event aimed at showcasing India's semiconductor strategy and policies, with the goal of establishing the country as a global hub for semiconductor manufacturing.

Zomato shares hit 52-week high. Is there more upside? Global brokerage firms like Jefferies and JP Morgan have also shown optimism, maintaining a 'buy' recommendation. Jefferies set a target price of Rs 335 for Zomato, reinforcing the positive sentiment.
Explained: Why Tata Motors shares slumped nearly 6% today At 11:30 am, Tata Motors shares were trading 5.57% lower at Rs 977.80 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.
Sensex, Nifty gain in volatile trade, Tata Motors plunges 5%, Zomato up 3%The S&P BSE was up 106.96 points at 82,030.60, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 32.85 points to 25,073.95 at 11:20 am.

Samsung India layoffs: Tech giant set to cut 200 jobs, says reportSamsung layoffs: The job cuts will affect various departments, including mobile phones, consumer electronics, home appliances, and support functions.

Mahindra, Pidilite, Dr Reddy's refute conflict allegations involving Dhaval BuchMahindra & Mahindra, Dr. Reddy's Laboratories, and Pidilite Industries have refuted Congress's allegations of conflict of interest involving SEBI Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch's husband. The companies clarified their engagements with Dhaval Buch were based on his expertise and predate her SEBI tenure.

New toll rules: Pay only for distance covered, no charges for first 20 kmThe new toll rules are part of the revised National Highways Fee Rules, 2024, which now focus on a pay-as-you-go system based on the distance you travel beyond the initial 20 km.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO booked 8x on Day 2. Check expected listing gainsBajaj Housing Finance is offering its shares in the price range of Rs 66-70 each. Investors can apply for a minimum of 214 shares and in multiples thereafter.

Mutual fund assets hit record Rs 66 lakh crore in AugustData from the Association for Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) shows that inflows into equity mutual funds rose by 3% in August, reaching Rs 38,239 crore.

Noida's housing dream fades as proposed rate hike pushes homes out of reachNoida's once-affordable housing dream is slipping away as soaring property prices and a proposed circle rate hike threaten to push homeownership further out of reach for the urban middle class.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by rally in IT and pharma stocks The S&P BSE Sensex added 361.75 points to end at 81,921.29, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.70 points to close at 25,041.10.

US election risk looms over Wall Street, but there are bigger threatsRight now, Wall Street is facing some uncertain moments as investors keep a close eye on the US stock rally, with the presidential election and other big economic factors coming into play.

Mahindra Group rejects conflict of interest claims over payments to Dhaval BuchIn a stock exchange filing, the Mahindra Group has clarified that Dhaval Buch was hired for his supply chain expertise, unrelated to the Sebi approvals cited by the Congress party.

Swiggy plans to raise Rs 5,000 crore in upcoming IPO through fresh issueThe Bengaluru-based firm had earlier planned to raise Rs 3,750 crore through fresh issue, along with an additional Rs 6,664 crore offer for sale.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO subscribed over 4x, GMP nears 100%Bajaj Housing Finance has demonstrated impressive growth, with a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 30.9% in AUM from Fiscal 2022 to 2024.

Jupiter Wagons stock down 12% in a month. Is it a buying opportunity?On Tuesday, the stock extended its losses, dropping to a day's low of Rs 490. At 1:22 pm, shares of Jupiter Wagons were trading 1.24% lower at Rs 502.45.

P N Gadgil Jewellers IPO opens: Should you subscribe or skip?P N Gadgil Jewellers IPO is a book-built issue which includes a fresh issue of 1.77 crore shares, amounting to Rs 850 crore, and an offer for sale of 52 lakh shares, totalling Rs 250 crore.

Explained: Why Tata Power shares soared over 5% today Tata Power shares jumped after the company's subsidiary, TP Solar, began commercial production of solar cells at its new plant in Tirunelveli, Tamil Nadu.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Amit Shah attacks Rahul Gandhi over 'anti-national statements' in USUnion Home Minister Amit Shah said Rahul Gandhi's statement "lays bare the Congress's politics of causing rifts on the lines of regionalism, religion, and linguistic differences".

Hindenburg questions Madhabi Puri Buch's silence on Congress' allegationsHindenburg Research's statement comes after the Congress party raised fresh allegations about Buch's links to listed companies regulated by Sebi. The short-seller also said that Madhabi Puri Buch has remained silent on the accusations for weeks.

Actor Malaika Arora's father jumps to death from building terrace Bollywood actor and model Malaika Arora's father, Anil Arora, died by suicide after jumping off a building terrace on Wednesday, police said.

Kamala Harris confident, unscathed; Trump fails to deliver a knockoutAn aggressive Kamala Harris managed to get under her rival Donald Trump's skin, hammering him over his criminal convictions, his views on abortion rights and the size of his rallies.
Can sticking a band-aid to your kid's navel fix car sickness?Does your child suffer from motion sickness? This travel hack could be of some help, but there's a catch!

Locals, cops clash in Shimla during protest over 'illegal' construction in mosquePolice resorted to lathicharge and use of water cannons in order to disperse the angry protesters while they were on their way to the mosque.

Elon Musk's low blow to Taylor Swift: I'll give you a child, guard your catsElon Musk's remark came shortly after pop star Taylor Swift said she would be voting for Kamala Harris in the US presidential election in November following the latter's debate with Donald Trump.

BJP's 'anti-India friends' jab as Rahul Gandhi meets US lawmaker Ilhan OmarRahul Gandhi's meeting with Ilhan Omar, who is the representative for Minnesota's 5th congressional district, drew sharp criticism from the BJP.

The big US presidential debate: Lotus squelches former PotusRepublicans are morose, while Democrats are optimistic – in fact, so optimistic that they have offered a second debate. The biggest revelation of Tuesday night: Harris is a gun owner, something that was written about in 2019 but was not widely known.
Tremors felt in Delhi-NCR as 5.8 earthquake jolts PakistanAn earthquake of magnitude 5.8 struck Pakistan on Wednesday. Mild tremors were felt in Delhi and surrounding areas.

Who was Malaika Arora's father, Anil AroraActor-model Malaika Arora's father Anil Arora has died by suicide. The police is currently investigating the matter. Meanwhile, Malaika's former husband Arbaaz Khan has reached her home.

You can bet on India when chips are down: PM Modi at Semicon India 2024Semicon India 2024 is a three-day event aimed at showcasing India's semiconductor strategy and policies, with the goal of establishing the country as a global hub for semiconductor manufacturing.

How Buddhism rode on mangoes to spread in India and abroad is aam kahaniThe story of Buddhism is intricately woven with the mango. The fruit plays a crucial role in Jataka tales, which suggests how Buddha must have used the fruit to explain difficult concepts to the aam janta of his time. Buddhism also rode the mango to spread in India and abroad, writes Sopan Joshi in his new book.

Vinesh Phogat says no support from PT Usha, 'politics' played during Olympics sagaFormer India wrestler Vinesh Phogat has accused Indian Olympic Association President PT Usha for not providing her support during the Paris Olympics 2024.

'This was Kamala Harris's night': X users declare Democrat winner of debateThis was the first debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump after President Joe Biden ended his re-election bid in July.

Jayam Ravi's wife Aarti: Divorce announcement was made without my consentJayam Ravi's estranged wife Aarti Ravi shared her first statement regarding the dissolution of their marriage. In the statement, she explained that she was blindsided by Ravi's announcement, which was made without her consent.

Kamala Harris's expressions to Trump's statements inspire hilarious memes#Debate2024 is one of the top trends on X as Kamala Harris and Donald Trump debated on subjects including abortion rights, the economy, immigration and border issues as well as the Israel-Gaza war.

Rahul Gandhi's remark on Sikhs justifies demand for Khalistan: Terrorist PannunKhalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun said Rahul Gandhi's statement on the "existential threat to Sikhs in India is not only bold and pioneering, but is also firmly grounded in the factual history of what Sikhs have been facing under successive regimes in India since 1947".
Arbaaz Khan arrives at Malaika Arora's house after her father's deathActor Arbaaz Khan rushed to ex-wife Malaika Arora's mother's house after hearing about her father Anil Arora's tragic death.

Two more children, both 11, attacked by lone wolf in UP's BahraichThe lone wolf of the pack of six wolves, which terrorised residents of Bahraich, attacked two 11-year-old girls. The wolf snatched both of them while they were sleeping on their cot.

SRK's new hairstyle at IIFA 2024 event creates buzzShah Rukh Khan surprised fans after he debuted a new look at the International Indian Film Academy (IIFA) press conference in Mumbai on September 10. The actor is set to host the grand event with Karan Johar and Vicky Kaushal.

Abortion to immigration: Key takeaways from Kamala Harris-Trump's first debateIn their first presidential debate, Kamala Harris and Donald Trump sparred over key issues including the economy, immigration, foreign policy, abortion, and the Capitol attack, with both sides claiming victory afterward.

Delhi, parts of north and central India to see heavy rain for next 4 daysA depression that formed over the Bay of Bengal and currently lying over Chhattisgarh is expected to result in significant rainfall across Delhi as well as east Haryana, west Uttar Pradesh (UP), Uttarakhand and north Madhya Pradesh (MP) between September 11 to 14.
Sunita Williams does orbital plumbing after Starliner returns emptyWilmore and Williams congratulated flight teams and bid farewell to the Starliner spacecraft that launched them to the ISS in June.
Raid 2: Ajay Devgn, Vaani Kapoor's film to release in February 2025Ajay Devgn and Vaani Kapoor's Raid 2 will release in theatres in 2025. The film also stars Riteish Deshmukh in a key role.

Meena Kumari, Kamal Amrohi's love story to be adapted into a filmA film adaptation of Meena Kumari and Kamal Amrohi's love story has been announced. Titled Kamal Aur Meena, the film will be directed by Siddharth P Malhotra.

Who was Malaika Arora's father, Anil AroraActor-model Malaika Arora's father Anil Arora has died by suicide. The police is currently investigating the matter. Meanwhile, Malaika's former husband Arbaaz Khan has reached her home.

Akon, K-pop idol Lucas to headline Shillong's Cherry Blossom Festival in NovemberGlobal sensation Akon will headline the Cherry Blossom Festival 2024 in Shillong. Various other artists such as Boney M and K-pop star Lucas are also a part of the line-up.

sports.headline: Vinesh Phogat claims lack of support during Olympic ordeal: What's the truth?India Today's Nikhil Naz dissects Vinesh Phogat's explosive claims about lack of support and politics during her Paris Olympic ordeal. The former wrestler accused Indian Olympic Association chief PT Usha of not supporting her in Paris. Vinesh returned empty-handed from the Olympics after her appeal against disqualification was rejected.

OTD in 2023: Kohli-Rahul's hundreds power India to biggest win over PakistanOn this day last year, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul's blistering hundreds guided India to their biggest-ever win over Pakistan in Asia Cup 2023. India won the contest by 228 runs against Pakistan.

New coach Mauricio Pochettino promises 'something special' for USA football The USA senior national men's team appointed former Chelsea boss Mauricio Pochettino as their new head coach on Tuesday. The Argentine tactician said the decision to join the USA team was influenced by more than just football.

PM Modi's heartfelt letter for PR Sreejesh: 'The wall between victory and defeat' Prime Minister Narendra Modi wrote a heartfelt letter for former India hockey player PR Sreejesh hailing him for his contribution in the national team.

Kieron Pollard unleashes six-hitting prowess to guide TKR to win in CPL 2024 Kieron Pollard rewind the clock as he unleashed his six-hitting prowess during the match between Trinbago Knight Riders and St Lucia Kings at CPL 2024. Pollard hit an unbeaten fifty to guide TKR to the win.

England vs Australia T20I series: H2H, all you need to knowEngland and Australia will renew their rivalry in T20Is as both teams will lock horns on September 11, Wednesday at The Rose Bowl in Southampton.

Kevin de Bruyne slams Belgium team-mates after loss to FranceBelgium captain Kevin De Bruyne slammed his teammates and questioned the manager's tactical decisions after his team's 2-0 loss to France in the Nations League.

South Africa unsure about Quinton de Kock's T20I future: Rob WalterSouth Africa white-ball coach Rob Walter said they're unsure about Quinton de Kock's T20I future after he was omitted from the team for a second consecutive series.

Neeraj Chopra, Avinash Sable to compete in Diamond League final in BrusselsAvinash Sable, the national record holder in the 3000m steeplechase, will compete in his first Diamond League Final in Brussels, joining star javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra in the season-ending event.

England disrepected Test cricket during Oval loss to Sri Lanka: Michael VaughanMichael Vaughan slammed England and claimed that they disrespected Test cricket with their strategies in the Oval Test loss to Sri Lanka. England were slammed for being over-aggressive with their approach.

Pakistan win is in the past: Litton wary of India's SG balls ahead of Test seriesIndia vs Bangladesh: Litton Das said their heroics against Pakistan are behind them and that they must now focus on the upcoming series against India. Bangladesh will travel to India on September 15 to play two Tests and three T20 Internationals.

Glad that I was able to change the colour of the medal: Archer HarvinderArcher Harvinder Singh, who won gold in the Paris Paralympics said that he was glad to be able to change the colour of his medal. Harvinder had earlier won bronze in Tokyo Paralympics.

Nishad Kumar elated with tremendous support after historic Paralympics campaignHigh-jumper Nishad Kumar was welcomed with a rousing reception at the Delhi Airport on Tuesday, September 10. The silver medallist in the Paris Paralympics said that he was elated to see the kind support India offered during the Games.

The silver medallist in the Paris Paralympics said that he was elated to see the kind support India offered during the Games.

AFG vs NZ may be Greater Noida's last international match, eyes on referee's reportThe international cricket match between Afghanistan and New Zealand at Greater Noida's Shaheed Vijay Singh Pathik Sports Complex may be the venue's last, subject to the match referee's report. Inadequate infrastructure and rain disruptions have raised concerns about the venue's future.

Hong Kong Open: Chirag Sen, Manav Choudhary knocked out in qualifiersIndia's Chirag Sen and Manav Choudhary were knocked out in the qualifiers of the Hong Kong Open on Tuesday, September 10. While Chirag was knocked out in the Round of 16 of his qualification round, Manav lost in the quarter-finals.

Babar Azam trolled after failing in practice matchPakistan batter Babar Azam was trolled on social media by fans after failing to score big runs in a practice game. Babar, who has been going through a terrible patch of form got out trying to play a sweep shot against a left-arm spinner.

Mbappe, Yamal, Bellingham: Cristiano Ronaldo picks future Ballon d'Or winnersCristiano Ronaldo has picked Kylian Mbappe, Erling Haaland, Jude Bellingham and Lamine Yamal as future Ballon d'Or winners. Ronaldo is a five-time winner of the award.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
